alert.note: Alert for Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued November 11 at 2:01PM EST until November 11 at 2:30PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Central Sussex County in southeastern Virginia... * Until 230 PM EST. * At 200 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 7 miles south of Sussex, or 14 miles northwest of Courtland, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Sussex around 210 PM EST. Homeville around 220 PM EST. Waverly around 230 PM EST. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Gray, Newville, Booker, Yale, Lumberton, Littleton and Hilda. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
